data.title: Colleges & Universities Near Phoenix, Arizona
data.meta_description: Looking for a list of the best colleges and universities in Phoenix, Arizona? Get a detailed list and breakdown of colleges near Phoenix, Arizona here.
data.text:
Colleges Near Phoenix, Arizona

Looking for information about the best colleges and universities serving Phoenix? Here's your guide to the top schools offering degrees to students in the area, including institutions located within 20 miles of Phoenix, Arizona.

There are at least 50 colleges serving the area, including 23 private colleges and universities, 2 public colleges and universities, and 9 community colleges offering 2-year degrees.

The Best Adult Colleges & Careers Guide provides a breakdown of the colleges serving Phoenix, with details about cost, enrollment, student type and degree offerings. Click here to learn more about the guide.

Community Colleges Near Phoenix, Arizona

There are 9 community colleges near Phoenix, Arizona where students can earn 2-year associate degrees. In 2022, about 54,679 students were enrolled in undergraduate courses at community colleges near Phoenix, and about 8,746 associate degrees were completed.

Affordable Colleges Near Phoenix, Arizona

Wondering what you can expect to pay for a degree near Phoenix, Arizona? According to undergraduate tuition data from the U.S. Department of Education College Scorecard, the average tuition at Phoenix-area's 4-year nonprofit schools is $21,941. The average tuition at similar 4-year for-profit schools near Phoenix is $16,679, while tuition at 2-year online colleges and universities is N/A.

4-Year Nonprofit

$21,941

/year

4-Year For-Profit

/year

Accredited Colleges Serving Phoenix, Arizona

Earning a college degree is an investment — and earning a degree from an institutionally accredited university is one of the best ways to ensure your education is of high quality. Institutionally accredited universities are held to rigorous standards by state and regional bodies and undergo regular reviews to verify that their processes and academic programs meet the proper standards.

Wondering if a certain college or university offering degree programs in Phoenix, Arizona is institutionally accredited? View a list of institutionally accredited colleges and universities serving Phoenix, Arizona here. We've made it easy to find your school by breaking down the list by school type.

Phoenix, Arizona Job Market & Opportunities

What happens after you earn your college degree in Phoenix? What's the Phoenix, Arizona job market outlook? Get a snapshot of jobs and careers, including annual job openings, median earnings and more.

In 2022, there were about 2,958,890 jobs in the Phoenix, Arizona area. From 2021-2022, job growth in Phoenix was above the national average, at 4%. There were 400,995 job openings in the area. In terms of earnings, workers in Phoenix do better than the national average, with an average hourly pay of $21.82.
